text: I use a lot of spices in this Moroccan
chickpea stew because I want it to be
really aromatic and very rich I add a
little bit of swiss chard because that
makes it bright and green and for
sweetness chopped up dried apricots some
people like to put everything in the pot
at once and let it bubble together but I
like to layer the flavors because I
think you get more out of them chili
garlic salt you're looking for
everything to get a little bit soft just
a little brown on the edges add your
ginger and then your spices so I've got
turmeric cayenne cinnamon sweet paprika
cumin black pepper make sure that you
are toasting these spices you should
smell them before you add anything else
to the pot and then now I'm gonna add
tomato paste let that get nice and
caramelized that was 2 tablespoons and
Sherman is exactly 2 tablespoons and
even more vegetables fennel carrots this
is rainbow chard I've taken the leaves
off we're gonna add the stems first so
that they get nice and soft in the stew
and then turn it this turn up does not
get enough love so I have to add it all
winter long two things here is the star
of the stew these are chickpeas I have
soaked them overnight and then you need
water you just need it barely covered ah
silence when you add the water it all
goes quiet you're just cooking this long
enough to soften the chickpeas and then
all the flavors are going to integrate
once it's simmer ease angle the lid a
little bit to allow steam to escape and
also for it to reduce so soon as your
chickpeas are tender check for the level
of liquid you want it to be tstewy
because there's no broth in here you
need to make sure it has enough salt
because salt brings out all the other
flavors and it makes it come together an
important lesson in cooking in general
okay so remember how I added the chard
stems I have got the greens right here
and I'm just going to let them cook for
a few minutes just to wilt into the
Stu I'm going to finish the stew by
adding preserved lemon and dried
apricots and that's really what makes it
more rocking and style bright and lively
and sweet and delicious hmm spices
